sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia has reacted angrily after Warsaw city authorities closed down their secondary school which had been run by the Russian Embassy in Poland. Moscow denounced it as a blatant violation of international agreements and warned of harsh consequences. On Saturday the school was starting to be emptied.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The whole process sped up since the invasion and why now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I guess that's because of the Polish government's request to the city to do this now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev lashed out on Twitter saying that there was no point in maintaining diplomatic relations with Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is full of Polish mercenaries who should be ruthlessly exterminated like stinking rats, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Poland says there's a big disparity in the number of diplomatic buildings each has in the other's country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A massive fire is continuing to blaze at an oil reservoir in Sevastopol in Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Moscow says it was hit by two drones early on Saturday morning, but that the fire is now under control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A Russian-installed governor posted videos of the blaze on his Telegram channel, adding that there were no casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian officials have not clarified if the drones were Ukrainian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: not clarified if the drones were Ukrainian. Russia first invaded Ukraine in 2014 and annexed the strategic Crimean Peninsula, which is now home to the Black Sea Fleet. It has come under repeated air attacks since Russia's full-scale invasion last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the second day of his visit to Hungary, Francis chose to meet with refugees and poor people

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: in Budapest's St. Elizabeth Church, and he thanked Hungarians for taking the refugees into their country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Viktoria Kalynchuk fled with her autistic daughter Veronika two weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thanks to the charity Maltese Relief, she's been able to start a new life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Amongst those gathered at the church were also refugees from other conflicts in Afghanistan, Iran, Nigeria and South Sudan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Pope then spoke to thousands of young people at the Budapest Sport Arena.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He asked them to help each other believe that they are loved, precious and destined for great things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Turkey's president, Recep Tayyip Erdoganan has reappeared in public after three days out of the public eye in the middle of an election campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to his officials, he'd been suffering from a stomach bug.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He reappeared at an air show in Istanbul, looking frailer than usual and fumbling with a bouquet of flowers before the camera cut away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Erdogan has been in power for 20 years, and at 69 years of age, questions have arisen about his state of health.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: With just two weeks to go, most polls show him slightly behind his secular rival, Kemal KucderoÄŸlu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If Erdogan were to be defeated, it would be an historic moment for Turkey and signal the start of a new era.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At the military airshow which Turkey described as the biggest in the world, he was accompanied by President Ilham Aliyev of Azerbaijan and Prime Minister Abdelhamid Dubeybe of Libya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A bronze sculpture of a walrus named Freya, who gained global attention last summer, has been unveiled in Oslo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She'd been playfully basking in the fjord until officials decided to euthanize her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They assessed that she'd become too stressed and also posed a threat to humans, who came too close to the 600 kilogram mammal to take pictures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That decision sparked anger and became the motivation behind the statue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: First of all, I was very provoked by the way Freyja was treated and how her life was ended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: First of all, a lot of people did not follow the rules and the instructions around how to treat Freyja when she was in the marina. People were a little too curious and a little too close. Many people thought the decision to put her down was rushed, but officials said moving her to a less populated area would have been too complex an operation.
